hadiths.text: It was narrated from Abu Razin that he heard the Prophet (ﷺ) say:“Dreams are attached to the foot of a bird* until they are interpreted, then when they are interpreted they come to pass.” He said: “And dreams are one of the forty-six parts of prophecy.” He (the narrator) said: “And I think he said: ‘(A person) should not tell them except to one whom he loves or one who is wise.’”

chapter.ara-name: باب الرُّؤْيَا إِذَا عُبِرَتْ وَقَعَتْ فَلاَ يَقُصُّهَا إِلاَّ عَلَى وَادٍّ
chapter.eng-name: If a dream is interpreted and it comes to pass (in that manner), he should not tell anyone about it except one whom he loves
